name: NSFormCell
desc: The NSFormCell class is used to implement text entry fields in a form. The left part of an NSFormCell object contains a title. The right part contains an editable text entry field.

items.name: init(textCell: String?)
items.desc: Returns an NSFormCell object initialized with the specified title string.

items.name: var isOpaque: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the title is empty and an opaque bezel is set.

items.name: var attributedTitle: NSAttributedString
items.desc: The title of the cell as an attributed string.

items.name: var titleBaseWritingDirection: NSWritingDirection
items.desc: The default writing direction used to render the form cell’s title.

items.name: var titleFont: NSFont
items.desc: The font used to draw cell’s title.

items.name: var titleWidth: CGFloat
items.desc: The width of the title field.

items.name: var placeholderString: String?
items.desc: The cell’s plain text placeholder string.

items.name: func titleWidth(NSSize) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Returns the width of the title field constrained to the specified size.
